content:
Heya; in today's announcement gif it's visible that we're generating unformatted output. Which is to say: we rely on cargo fmt to run to format the output we generate.

Changelog #89 is out! This release features struct literal completion, type coercion info on hover, improved display of rustc diagnostics, and we now generate a default impl when converting a `Debug` derive to a manual impl. https://rust-analyzer.github.io/thisweek/2021/08/09/changelog-89.html https://twitter.com/rust_analyzer/status/1424685014843854848/photo/1

- rust-analyzer (@rust_analyzer)

Is there code in the codebase available to move an item to a newline? I know of .indent which enables indenting code. But it seems like we need something else here to generate code with the "correct" output from the get-go.
I don't think so, but having something proper for this is tracked in https://github.com/rust-analyzer/rust-analyzer/issues/1665
